programmes.show_name: The V&A Presents Alice: Curiouser And Curiouser
programmes.show_description: Delve into the journey of Alice's Adventures in Wonderland through its origins and reinventions over the last 157 years in this immersive show.

programmes.show_name: New: Landscape Artist Of The Year 2026
programmes.show_description: New. Ouse Valley Viaduct: Stephen Mangan presents the semi-final of Landscape Artist of the Year at the historic Ouse Valley Viaduct in Sussex. (S11, ep 7)
Commentary from high-profile fans, such as writer Rowan Pelling, and dramatisations starring Lucy Cohu and Shivani Kapur, tell the scandalous story of author Anais Nin.

programmes.show_name: Inside Art: Night Fever At V&A Dundee
programmes.show_description: Kate Bryan explores a new exhibition that explores the relationship between club culture and design traversing the globe and spanning the 1960s to the present day.
The blouse Judy Garland wore in the film The Wizard of Oz goes up for sale in London, as do Warwick Castle's ornate Grimani Tables - valued at half a million pounds each. (S7, ep 3)
Items from the collection of the late Dowager Duchess of Devonshire come under the hammer at Sotheby's in London. Elsewhere, prints and multiples are offered at Christie's. (S7, ep 4)
As tensions between the pair threatened to tear Gilbert and Sullivan apart, impresario Richard D'Oyly Carte makes the decision to move the company to his newly built Savoy Theatre.

programmes.show_name: Nicola Benedetti & Friends From The Ulster Hall
programmes.show_description: Join Nicola Benedetti for a unique and personal show as she returns to the stage at the Ulster Hall for her first solo tour in over ten years.
Towering Glacier: In this masterpiece, Bob paints an immense ice-topped mountain looming over lush grassland and a stunning waterfall. (S11, ep 5)
Oval Barn: Bob uses all of his skill and experience to create a comforting winter scene, complete with a homely barn and fluffy bushes. (S11, ep 6)
I Like It Here In Wilmington: When a clothing manufacturer finds himself on the verge of bankruptcy, he ponders the idea of murdering his wife for the insurance money. (S7, ep 11)
Accidental Death: Steve and Jane are con artists who gain access to people's homes claiming to be doing research into polish. But eventually, they meet their match. (S7, ep 12)
Don't Come Back Alive: Frank Partridge and his wife cheat their insurance company by declaring her legally dead, but an investigator believes Mr Partridge has killed her. (S1, ep 5)
Into Thin Air: A young woman's mother goes missing when left alone in a Parisian hotel room and much to her dismay, hotel staff deny the mother and daughter were ever there. (S1, ep 6)
A look at the life and career of American filmmaker Nancy Meyers, known for The Parent Trap, The Holiday and Something's Gotta Give. (S8, ep 8)
An eye-opening profile of Peter Sellers, from his early life and work on the Goon Show to his starring role as Chief Inspector Clouseau in The Pink Panther film series. (S6, ep 6)
The Reconciliation: Seeking a divorce from his wife, an unhappy husband hires a private eye in the hopes of catching her with another man. But things don't quite go as expected. (S7, ep 13)
The Mugger: When a married politician falls in love with a woman at a party, things soon go wrong and his entire career and reputation are put in jeopardy. (S7, ep 14)

programmes.show_name: Dickens In Italy With David Harewood
programmes.show_description: David Harewood investigates the impact Italy had on Charles Dickens, discovering that the quintessentially English author was far more cosmopolitan than expected.
The chosen six are faced with the daunting challenge of singing in front of each other. Coaches Nicky, Sarah and Michael prepare them with one-to-one tutorials. (2 of 4)
A look at the life and career of the legendary actor-turned-director Clint Eastwood, known for Unforgiven, Million Dollar Baby and American Sniper. (S8, ep 9)
A look at the life and career of British actor Robert Shaw. Often cast in menacing roles, he is widely remembered for his performance as shark hunter Quint in Jaws. (S6, ep 7)
The Open Window: When a young man climbs through the window of a Connecticut hunting lodge, he emerges on the other side in a strange new world. (S7, ep 15)
People Don't Do Such Things: Trouble looms when married woman Gwen falls for a successful romantic novelist. (S8, ep 1)
Salvage: Dan Varrell, a gangster, has just secured release from prison, but so soon as his release he's back on the hunt for a woman culpable for his brother's death. (S1, ep 7)
Breakdown: William Callew is involved in a horrific traffic incident on a rural road that leaves him with life-changing injuries. (S1, ep 8)

programmes.show_name: New: Landscape Artist Of The Year 2026
programmes.show_description: New. Ouse Valley Viaduct: Stephen Mangan presents the semi-final of Landscape Artist of the Year at the historic Ouse Valley Viaduct in Sussex. (S11, ep 7)

programmes.show_name: New: Dr. Strangelove: National Theatre Live
programmes.show_description: New. Steve Coogan plays four roles in the stage adaptation of Stanley Kubrick's comedy masterpiece Dr Strangelove.

programmes.show_name: Science Fiction In The Atomic Age
programmes.show_description: New. Margaret Atwood to Ted Chiang: Space travel revives exploration and conquest traditions, highlighting new possibilities for human life. (S1, ep 3)
The last episode of the series takes a deep dive into the life and career of John Carpenter, known for his cult classics such as Dark Star, The Thing and Halloween. (S6, ep 10)

programmes.show_name: Catching Fire: The Story Of Anita Pallenberg
programmes.show_description: This intimate documentary reveals the story of a fierce rock 'n' roller, actress, muse and mother who rose to prominence in the 1960s and 1970s.
Documentary exploring the once grand and thriving Roman city of Pompeii, as told by the writers and artists of the era who visited and imagined it.
Photographers who captured some of the world's most extraordinary images share the stories behind their craft and careers. (6 of 6)
In Burgundy, France, the Hospice de Beaune wine auction takes place - the most famous charity wine sale in the world, dating back to 1795. (S7, ep 5)
In Staffordshire, Bonhams is selling eight rare Brough motorbikes - made famous by Lawrence of Arabia. Meanwhile in London, Christie's is selling Old Masters. (S7, ep 6)

programmes.show_name: Andre Rieu: La Vie Est Belle
programmes.show_description: Dutch violinist Andr√© Rieu brings his orchestra to an atmospheric Berlin amphitheatre, with musical favourites like Ravel's Bolero, Lara's Theme from Doctor Zhivago and Auld Lang Syne.
Lakeside Path: Misty background evergreens and a cheerful blue sky give Bob the ideal setting in this stunning masterpiece. (S11, ep 7)
Sunset Oval: Bob uses a golden selection of colours in this gorgeous mountain scene, all inside a unique oval shape on canvas. (S11, ep 8)

A look at the life and career of the legendary actor-turned-director Clint Eastwood, known for Unforgiven, Million Dollar Baby and American Sniper. (S8, ep 9)
A look at the life and career of British actor Robert Shaw. Often cast in menacing roles, he is widely remembered for his performance as shark hunter Quint in Jaws. (S6, ep 7)

programmes.show_name: Dickens In Italy With David Harewood
programmes.show_description: David Harewood investigates the impact Italy had on Charles Dickens, discovering that the quintessentially English author was far more cosmopolitan than expected.
The singers prepare to perform in public for the first time, with the scale of the audience unknown. Luckily, Welsh superstar mezzo-soprano Katherine Jenkins is on hand. (3 of 4)
A look at the life and career of the celebrated Taiwanese filmmaker Ang Lee, known for Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon, Brokeback Mountain and Life of Pi. (S8, ep 10)
A look at the life and career of Rex Harrison, the Oscar-winning English actor who starred as Professor Henry Higgins in the 1964 film musical My Fair Lady. (S6, ep 8)
In The Cards: Fortuneteller Madame Myra thinks she is on to a winner when she meets a man prophesied to come in to a lot of money before dying shortly after. (S8, ep 2)
Nothin' Short Of Highway Robbery: On a long drive through the desert, a couple get their car serviced and are handed an extortionate bill. But they plan on turning the tables. (S8, ep 3)

A glimpse into the world of the Academy-Award winning actor and filmmaker, known for his work in The Fugitive, Men In Black, Batman Forever and more. (S12, ep 5)

programmes.show_name: Classic Movies: The Story Of The Third Man
programmes.show_description: In this opening episode, movie critic Ian Nathan examines the qualities that made this 1949 film noir starring Orson Welles an enduring classic. (S1, ep 1)
Great Adventure Novel Adaptations: Going back to ancient Greece, nothing has captured imaginations quite like a great adventure story - a genre tailor-made for film adaptation. (S1, ep 2)
A look at the life of the celebrated filmmaker of hits Walkabout, Don't Look Now and Bad Timing. His unique style made him a highly influential filmmaker. (S5, ep 5)
